'''Shubhavi Arya''' is an animator and film director born on 7 October 1998.
She is most noted for creating cutout [[stop-motion]] animated film [[Adventures of Malia]] at a young age of 16 years. In 2015, she directed and animated the [[Adventures of Malia]] which got nominated for 11 international film awards, winning 3 of them including the Honorary Mention Foreign Film Award at the ColorTape International Film Festival, Australia and Best Under 18 Filmmaker at the Global Independent Film Awards, United States.<ref>{{cite web|title=Global Independent Film Awards Winners|url=http://rethinkingtaxes.com/global-independent-film-awards-august-2015-winners/|website=Rethinking Taxes}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|title=Washington News World|url=http://www.washingtonnewsworld.com/item/entertainment/8283/GLOBAL-INDEPENDENT-FILM-AWARDS-AUGUST-2015-WINNERS|website=GLOBAL INDEPENDENT FILM AWARDS AUGUST 2015 WINNERS}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|title=Global Independent Film Awards August winners|url=http://www.dailynewsdetroit.com/item/latest-news/7918/GLOBAL-INDEPENDENT-FILM-AWARDS-AUGU|website=Daily News Detroit}}</ref>super women
== Early life and background == Shubhavi Arya was born in New Delhi, India. Shubhavi's father, Jaibir Singh Arya, is a Haryana Civil Service Officer and her mother, Minakshi Arya, is a [[veterinary]] surgeon, both of whom work in the [[Government of India]]. She has one younger brother.<ref>{{cite web|title=brother-sister duo Shubhavi and Saatvik Arya|url=http://photogallery.indiatimes.com/events/delhi/national-ice-skating-championship/articleshow/45777434.cms|website=Times of India}}</ref>
== Education == Shubhavi Arya is currently studying Software Engineering at the [[University of Minnesota]]. Shubhavi Arya used to study at the [[Canadian International School (Singapore)|Canadian International School]] in Singapore in grade 9 and 10.<ref>{{cite web|title=Week at a Glance – TK – 23 November 2012|url=http://www.cis.edu.sg/cf_news/view.cfm?newsid=259|website=Canadian International School}}</ref> She was home-schooled in grades 11 and 12. She pursued [[Edexcel]] International [[A-Levels]] as a private candidate. Her [[A-Level]] subjects include Math, Physics, Chemistry, Biology and Business Studies.<ref>{{cite web|title=Shubhavi Arya|url=http://www.shubhaviarya.com/shubhavi-resume.pdf|website=Shubhavi Arya}}</ref> In June 2015 at the age of 16 years in grade 11, she took [[A-Level]] examination in Mathematics and achieved A* grade. She also took AS Level examination in Physics and received A grade. She is also currently studying Swedish language.
Shubhavi received full merit based scholarship worth S$63,962 at the [[Canadian International School (Singapore)|Canadian International School]], Singapore in grades 9 and 10<ref>{{cite web|title=Congratulations to Shubhavi Arya MUN Conference Verbal Commendation Award Recipient|url=http://www.cis.edu.sg/cf_news/view.cfm?newsid=259|website=Canadian international school}}</ref> in 2012 which is the highest scholarship received by an Indian high school student. She was also the recipient of the Academic Scholarship for grades 11 and 12 worth S$10,000 at the [[German European School Singapore|German European School]], Singapore in 2014. She was shortlisted for the merit-based IB Diploma Scholarship worth INR {{formatnum:4600000}} at Global Indian International School, Singapore.<ref>{{cite web|title=shubhavi arya|url=http://www.shubhaviarya.com/|website=shubhavi arya}}</ref> In 2009, she also received academic scholarship worth INR 800 by the International Children Equity Fund for excelling at national level in Math, Science and English in India.
She has actively participated in many math and science competitions. She participated in the [[American Mathematics Competition]], Singapore Junior Chemistry Olympiad and the [[National Standard Examination in Physics|Indian National State Physics Olympiad]] (NSEP). She also took the Cayley Math Contest and the Galois Math Contest by the [[University of Waterloo]], Canada.
In grade 10, Shubhavi took 7 [[Cambridge International Examinations|CIE]] [[IGCSE]] exams as a private candidate while also attending regular IB school. She has also taken online college courses by [[Stanford University]] and [[University of Virginia]] through online platform [[Coursera]].
== Film career == Arya's interest in art and animation developed as a child. At the age of 12 years, she worked as an animator in animated short film "ZAP" which was screened at film festivals in Denmark and Serbia. In 2012, she got invited to Center for Animationspædagogik, The Animation Workshop, [[Viborg, Denmark|Viborg]], Denmark where she created an animated film for the Viborg Animation Festival along with her brother. She later set out to develop her own materials for her own next project and after an unusually long development period, she completed [[Adventures of Malia]] in 2015.
She has experimented with different styles of animation. She has been praised by the jury of [[CINE|CINE Golden Eagle Awards]] for her exceptional talent in animation at the age of 16 years. Jury of the Underexposed Film Festival complimented her vibrant style of filmmaking and appreciated the treatments that Shubhavi brought to the film '[[Adventures of Malia]]'. Other praise has included the jury of Insight Curation Scheme, United Kingdom who commended Shubhavi's distinctive animation style. Rock and Roll Film Festival 2015, Kenya agreed by saying "16-year-old, Shubhavi Arya, shows great promise as she writes, directs and animates "The Adventures of Malia". If she carries on like this, it won't be long before she is winning a lot of awards for her work."
Her film [[Adventures of Malia]] was accepted for screening in over 10 countries in over 30 international [[film festivals]] including the [[Chicago International Film Festival|Chicago International Film Festival – ''Cine Youth'']], ENIMATION Little Elephant - International Children and Youth Film Festival, Slovenia,<ref>{{cite web|title=Selections 2015|url=http://enimation.si/program/Enimation_Little_Elephant_2015.pdf|website=Enimation.si}}</ref> Kratka Forma – The International Festival of Short Films 2015, Serbia and the [[Arlington International Film Festival]].It was the only Indian film to be a winner in the Global Independent Film Awards, United States in August 2015.<ref>{{cite web|title=Global Independent Film Awards August winners|url=http://www.dailynewsdetroit.com/item/latest-news/7918/GLOBAL-INDEPENDENT-FILM-AWARDS-AUGU|website=Daily News Detroit}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|title=Global Independent Film Awards August winners|url=http://couponjunki.com/global-independent-film-awards-august-2015-winners/|website=Coupon Junki}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|title=Global Independent Film Awards Winners|url=http://cyberbookin.com/global-independent-film-awards-august-2015-winners/|website=Cyberbookin}}</ref> It was the only selection from India at many international film festivals including the [[Chicago International Film Festival|51st Chicago International Film Festival – Cine Youth]] 2015, USA and Kratka Forma – The International Festival of Short Films<ref>{{cite web|title=Kratka Forma Selections 2015|url=http://kratkaforma.kcgm.org.rs/images/stories/dokumenta/selekcija/f.pdf|website=Kratka Forma}}</ref> 2015, Serbia. [[Adventures of Malia]] was the only film directed by an Under 18-year-old at the Twister Alley Film Festival 2015, USA.<ref>{{cite web|title=Kid Flix|url=http://www.twisteralleyfilmfestival.com/kid-flix.html|website=Twister Alley Film Festival 2015}}</ref>
Shubhavi is the youngest animator and film director in India to have had film screenings in over 30 international [[film festivals]].

== Non-film work == Shubhavi is accomplished in artistic roller skating and figure skating.<ref>{{cite web|title=Dlf City News|url=http://www.dlf.in/dlf/wcm/connect/a5c5564e-33f8-46b5-8e6a-b22780cc6267/February+-+2015+Edition.pdf?MOD=AJPERES&CACHEID=a5c5564e-33f8-46b5-8e6a-b22780cc6267|website=Dlf City News Magazine}}</ref> She is a silver medalist in the Asian Open Roller Skating Championship and is a National level figure skater.<ref>{{cite web|title=National Ice Skating Championship|url=http://photogallery.indiatimes.com/events/delhi/national-ice-skating-championship/articleshow/45777434.cms|website=Times of India}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|title=Dlf City News|url=http://www.dlf.in/dlf/wcm/connect/a5c5564e-33f8-46b5-8e6a-b22780cc6267/February+-+2015+Edition.pdf?MOD=AJPERES&CACHEID=a5c5564e-33f8-46b5-8e6a-b22780cc6267|website=Dlf City News}}</ref> She was the trainer and mentor for figure skating for the Indian delegation to [[Special Olympics World Games|Winter Special Olympics World Games]] 2013 in South Korea. The Indian team in figure skating won a gold medal, two silver medals and two bronze medals that year at the [[Special Olympics World Games|Winter Special Olympics World Games]].<ref>{{cite web|title=Special Olympics Winter Games|url=http://www.rediff.com/sports/report/indians-win-20-medal-in-special-olympics-world-winter-games/20130203.htm|website=Rediff}}</ref> Shubhavi also does ballet.
Shubhavi is fond of writing and advocacy related works. Shubhavi has been a member of the [[STAND: A Student Anti-Genocide Coalition|STAND]] Student Leadership Team since 2014. She is also a daily content contributor for Hello Flo<ref>{{cite web|title=Author Shubhavi Arya|url=http://blog.helloflo.com/author/shubhaviarya/|website=Hello Flo}}</ref> and magazine writer for Her Culture<ref>{{cite web|title=Magazine staff|url=http://www.herculture.org/shubhaviarya/|website=Her Culture}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|title=Her Culture Magazine|url=https://www.joomag.com/magazine/her-culture-bi-monthy-magazine-august-september-2015/0549853001438828177?page=9|website=Joomag}}</ref> and has written several articles for both. She is also a member of the American Society of News Editors-School Journalism.org Student Advisory Board.<ref>{{cite web|title=Student Advisory Board|url=http://www.schooljournalism.org/schools/advisory-board/|website=School Journalism.Org}}</ref>
She has also chaired several Model United Nations Conferences including the [[Harvard Model United Nations]], [[Yale International Relations Association#Model UN Affiliation|Yale Model United Nations]] and Model United Nations of Lubeck.<ref>{{cite web|title=MUNOL ECOSOC Report|url=http://www.munol.org/uploads/ResearchReports/2014/ECOSOC%20-%20Enhancing%20human%20resource%20development%20particularly%20in%20the%20area%20of%20volunteer%20work.pdf|website=MUNOL}}</ref> She was the Communications and Public Relations Manager for the Asian region in Reims International Model United Nations, France, a university level conference.<ref>{{cite web|title=Reims International Model UN Recap|url=http://bestdelegate.com/reims-international-model-united-nations-2014-recap/|website=Best Delegate}}</ref> In 2012, she also won Verbal Commendation Award at the [[UWC Mahindra College|United World College]] MUN.<ref>{{cite web|title=Congratulations to Shubhavi Arya MUN Conference Verbal Commendation Award Recipient|url=http://www.cis.edu.sg/cf_news/view.cfm?newsid=259|website=Canadian International School}}</ref>
She is talented in visual arts and painting. Her paintings have been held at several exhibitions including 'Tvak', 'Yellow Spring'<ref>{{cite web|title=Shows|url=http://www.escapismart.com/events|website=Escapism Art}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|title=yellow spring exhibition|url=http://allevents.in/new%20delhi/jitendra-padam-jain-yellow-spring-an-art-exhibition/80003143615778|website=all events}}</ref> and 'Sync'.<ref>{{cite web|title=Sree Arts presents Sync|url=http://www.delhievents.com/2013/04/sree-arts-presents-harmony-with-art.html|website=Delhi Events}}</ref> She received Most Promising Artist Award for the 'Yellow Spring' exhibition. In 2013, she won international painting competition "Achieve Thru Art Singapore".<ref>{{cite web|title=Multi-Talented: Shubhavi Arya|url=http://www.dlf.in/dlf/wcm/connect/a5c5564e-33f8-46b5-8e6a-b22780cc6267/February+-+2015+Edition.pdf?MOD=AJPERES&CACHEID=a5c5564e-33f8-46b5-8e6a-b22780cc6267|website=Dlf City News}}</ref> More than 400,000 students in Singapore, approximately 100 nationalities participated in this visual art competition to win air tickets to 12 destinations around the world. Shubhavi's artwork 'Religions' was a winner of destination [[Chennai]], India<ref>{{cite web|title=2013 Chennai, India winners|url=http://www.achievethruart.com/singapore/chennai-india-winners|website=Achieve Thru Art}}</ref> and her artwork 'Women of Different Countries' was a winner of destination [[Mumbai]], India.<ref>{{cite web|title=Mumbai, India winners 2013|url=http://www.achievethruart.com/singapore/mumbai-india-winners|website=Achieve Thru Art Singapore}}</ref> Her artwork 'Festivals' was a winner of destination [[Delhi]], India.<ref>{{cite web|title=Delhi, India winners|url=http://www.achievethruart.com/singapore/delhi-india-winners|website=Achieve Thru Art}}</ref> She received 6 return tickets from Singapore to [[Delhi]], [[Mumbai]] and [[Chennai]] as well as a $20 Changi Airport shopping voucher in the prize. In 2011, she also won second prize in India worth INR 10,000 in the 'Think Sydney Think Singapore Airlines' contest by [[Singapore Airlines]].<ref>{{cite web|title=Awards|url=http://www.shubhaviarya.com|website=Shubhavi Arya official site}}</ref> She is also pursuing a Diploma in painting from Rabindra Bharti University, India.
She has also spoken at several blood donation camps, Indian election campaigns and volunteered in many national campaigns of the [[Government of India]] including the [[Pulse Polio |Pulse Polio Immunization Program]], [[Beti Bachao, Beti Padhao Yojana]]''(Save the Girl Child, Educate the Girl Child)'' and [[Swachh Bharat Abhiyan]]''(Indian Sanitation Mission)''.
She has coded her own official website.

{{References|date=January 2015}} [[Image:MarquetryOriental.jpg|250px|thumb|right|Oriental marquetry motif]] '''Straw marquetry''' is a craft very similar to that of wood [[marquetry]], except that straw replaces the [[wood veneer]]. It is thought to have first been practised in the East; examples were brought to England in the 17th century.
To mimic the varying shades of wood veneer, [[wheat]] or [[oat]] straw has to be split, then soaked in cold, warm, or hot water. The strips are then ironed, and there will be a variety of tones from pale gold to deepest dark brown.
There are accounts of nuns in France and Switzerland making a variety of items using straw marquetry.
The most famous straw marquetry was practised by prisoners of war from the [[Napoleonic wars]]. Dartmoor and other prisons had been built for them; the prison most famous for straw marquetry was Norman Cross, [[Huntingdon]].
[[Easter eggs]] are decorated with [[straw]] [[applique]], especially in Eastern European countries. Geometric shapes, stars and flower motifs are the most common themes. There is a slight difference in the way the straw is prepared, however; for marquetry, the straws are soaked, split and ironed; for [[Egg (biology)|egg]] decoration the straw is not ironed.
